results.title: The Winger with Gordon Hill
results.creator_credit: Terry Ryan, Ray Marshall and Opix Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus on Soccer”.
Gordon Hill, Derby’s left-winger, shows that speed, accurate crossing and dribbling are vitally important to the winger’s game.

results.title: A History of the game
results.creator_credit: Terry Ryan, Ray Marshall and Opix Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Focus on Soccer”.
The first of a seven part series on soccer skills. Traces the history of soccer in England, and in the second half of the film Manchester City’s Mick Channon looks at the basic skills which every soccer player needs. Provides clear explan ations of training drills and relates these to actual match situations. Narrated by Hugh Jones.

results.title: Learning about learning
results.creator_credit: Mitchell Grayson, American Psychological Association and National Educational Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus on behaviour: the science of psychology”.
Explores the different strategies employed in developing new theoretical concepts about the human ability to learn. These studies, conducted with human beings and animals, have led to changes in methods of instruction.

results.title: The Conscience of a child (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Edmond Levy, Harold Mayer, American Psychological Society and Mayar-Sklar Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus on behaviour: the science of psychology”.
The ways in which psychologists are studying, in the laboratory of Dr. Robert Sears at Stanford University, the growth and development of personality and emotional behaviour in children. The roles portrayed by Eddie, his mother and father are re-enactments based on actual research and findings in Dr Sears’ experiment.

results.title: Third class third rate (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
FOCUS investigates the claim that some women in Australia are treated as third class citizens by their husbands. It tells of the life of a migrant woman who made the transition from old world values to modern day society.

results.title: Two Different Worlds (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
A story of children challenging the attitudes of their migrant parents and growing apart from their discipline and culture. The repercussions of holding two standards - that of their parents and that of the new Australian society. How do they cope with two values.
results.description:

results.title: A Shame Like Alice. Part 2 (A)
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee, SBS-TV and Lee Gordon Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Focus”.
Presents the view of the white population of Alice Springs concerning its Aborigines, including those of the mayor and a councillor concerning “assimilation” problems. Shows, in contrast, Aboriginal self-help ventures in education and health. Aborigines relate their feelings about the intrusion of the media and tourism into their lives. Includes interviews with the then Senator Neville Bonner and former Commissioner for Community Affairs, Al Grassby.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leonard Lee, SBS-TV and Lee Gordon Productions

results.title: A Shame like Alice. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee, SBS-TV and Lee Gordon Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Focus”.
A look at the plight of the Aboriginal people in and around Alice Springs, presenting the black viewpoint. Discusses racism in the town, the type of housing and services available to the Aboriginal people and other issues. Includes interviews with the then Senator Neville Bonner and former Commissioner for Community Relations, Al Grassby.
